response_parsed.title: Deploying Serverless Handlers Using FastAPI with Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide will walk you through the process of deploying serverless handlers using FastAPI, a modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.12+.
key_points: FastAPI is built on top of Starlette, ASGI, and Pydantic.
FastAPI supports multiple programming languages but this guide focuses on Python 3.12+.
Serverless deployment allows for scaling automatically based on traffic and eliminates the need to manage servers.
This guide demonstrates deploying FastAPI applications to AWS Lambda using the Serverless Framework.

code_examples.code:
service: my-fastapi-service
provider:
  name: aws
  runtime: python3.8
  region: us-east-1
functions:
  main:
    handler: my_project.main:app
    events:
      - httpApi:
          path: /
          method: ANY

caveats: Ensure you have the Serverless Framework installed and properly configured before proceeding.
The AWS Lambda runtime used in this example may not support all features of Python 3.12+
Make sure to test your deployed application thoroughly.
